description: Kick It Out CEO Samuel Okafor and ex-Chelsea defender Paul Elliott, former chair of the FA's inclusion and diversity board, talk to BBC Sport about the importance of appointing Liam Rosenior as Chelsea manager.

title: 'Who remembers Sir Alex Ferguson?' - Why Man Utd hire former players as interim managers
description: Monday Night Club‚Äôs Rory Smith and ex-Manchester United player Phil Jones discuss why the club appoint former players as interim managers, as Darren Fletcher takes on the role.

title: Boundaries, drops and no more reviews - England's morning to forget
description: Expensive overs, dropped catches and lost reviews sees England have a morning session to forget against Australia on day three of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Smith and Head score centuries as Australia punish England on day three
description: Travis Head scores 163 and Steve Smith ends unbeaten on 129 as Australia close on 518-7 in their first innings, leading England by 134 runs at stumps on day three of the fifth and final Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'He's like a gladiator' - Smith reaches century as Australia build lead
description: Australia captain Steve Smith leads from the front as he scores his 13th career Ashes century on his home ground to help his team to 449-7 in their first innings, giving them a 65-run lead against England on day three of the fifth Test in Sydney.

title: 'A moving moment' as Rosenior breaks barriers
description: Liam Rosenior's appointment as Chelsea manager is a "massive moment" for representation in the Premier League.

title: Battle of the Sexes 'brought eyes on tennis' - Sabalenka
description: Women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka defends the 'Battle of the Sexes' match against Nick Kyrgios after opening her season with a crushing win in Brisbane.

title: Amorim 'blow-up' brings Wilcox into the spotlight
description: Who is Manchester United's director of football Jason Wilcox and how did he become one of the most powerful figures in football?

title: 'Nancy blunder evidence of Celtic's blurred vision'
description: There is "no apparent big picture view at Celtic", argues BBC Sport Scotland's Tom English as Wilfried Nancy and Paul Tisdale exit the ailing champions.

title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
description: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

title: Head? Stokes? Starc? Pick your team of the Ashes
description: Australia have retained the Ashes, but who makes your combined team of the series?

title: The acclaimed muscial adaptation of a Roald Dahl classic
description: Matilda has a sharp mind, vivid imagination and the worst parents in the world.

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
description: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
description: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
description: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
description: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.

title: A race against the clock to make it home for Thanksgiving
description: The classic road trip comedy starring Steve Martin and John Candy
